lines.text: Excuse the slight interruption.
I finished the paragraph.
[he takes the book from her hand and tosses it aside]

[as he moves in for a kiss, she pulls away]
You know what that book is all about?
NO.
The Greeks.
You mean someone wrote a whole book about Nick and his cousins?
Someone wrote a whole book about the Greeks in Greece.
Oh them? The Greek Greeks?
Yea, and these one's are all dead!
Oh well, that's life!
[Once again moving in for kiss]
Yea, that's culture!
Baby, you can tell me all about it in the morning.
I'm liable to forget.
So you forget.
So who made me read the book?

[Finally feeling defeated in his attempt in being amorous, his slumps back on the couch and slowly says]
Alright, tell me about them Greeks.
Now say that someone did see a murder being committed.
Say it was you.
But why me?
We found your pills in that phone booth.
You've seen my wife. She doesn't belong on the firing line anywhere. And me? Well teachers just don't make great convincing heroes.
They make good witnesses.
You teach kids. How much do you know about juvenile delinquency?
A little.
It's increasing. You mentioned your wife. That she is going to have a kid. Don't you care about the world it grows up in?
I think your wife would Mr. Avery.

[after quite a bit of thinking]
Alright.
[pauses for a bit]
The car they used was a black sedan. the license number was JPF393...

[Voice coming out loudly over the speakers and suspects line-up for questioning]
Okay now. Turn and face front! I said face front! Get your hands down you not looking for anybody! You here to be looked at! Now, first man in line. That's right, you! What's your name, address and occupation...

[as the officer over the loud speaker continues giving instructions to the suspects]
Alright Mr.Avery. Take plenty of time. Look at these men over carefully.
I don't need anymore time. I'll not be able to forget either of these men as long as I live.
Identify.
It's the third man and the fifth man. The fifth man did the actual killing.
Are you sure Mr. Avery?
I'm sure.
Sure enough to testify in court Mr. Avery?
This is Capt. Finch.
Yes Capt. Finch.
You're a brave man Mr. Avery.
Why did they have to this to Chester? He was the only friend I got.
You still got me Maxie.
Oh you're a dame. Dames is dime a dozen.
Raise yourself another dime!
Wait a minute baby! You're ain't running out on me! After all them rocks I given and mink either?
Minks don't look good with bullet holes!
I bought you!
The sales been cancelled!
Hold on baby, I... I still got lot of dough!
Dead men got no dough!
Ahhhhhhh!
[Screams as Maxie approaches her and strangles her to death]
